heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm fell at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour over the 144.8 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 09 November 2025, the rain lasted for 144.8 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  47.89mm accumulated and it fell at 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 02 February 2026 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.6 mm) and cloud levels (up 110 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 61.5m lower than the past week, 109.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 604m and a peak of 818m, averaging 682.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be low, possibly causing overcast or foggy conditions, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
